    • Method Detail

      • addQueueData

        void addQueueData​(int publisherId,
                  int publishType,
                  String fingerprint,
                  PublisherQueueVolatileInformation queueData,
                  int publishStatus)
           throws javax.ejb.CreateException
        Adds an entry to the publisher queue.
        Parameters:
        publisherId - the publisher that this should be published to
        publishType - the type of entry it is, PublisherQueueData#PUBLISH_TYPE_CERT or CRL
        fingerprint - FP
        queueData - Daya
        publishStatus - status
        Throws:
        javax.ejb.CreateException - if the entry can not be created

        void removeQueueData​(String pk)
        Removes an entry from the publisher queue.
        Parameters:
        pk - pk

      • getPendingEntriesForPublisher

        Collection<PublisherQueueData> getPendingEntriesForPublisher​(int publisherId)
        Finds all entries with status PublisherQueueData.STATUS_PENDING for a specific publisherId.
        Parameters:
        publisherId - Id
        Returns:
        Collection of PublisherQueueData, never null

      • getPendingEntriesCountForPublisher

        int getPendingEntriesCountForPublisher​(int publisherId)
        Gets the number of pending entries for a publisher.
        Parameters:
        publisherId - The publisher to count the number of pending entries for.
        Returns:
        The number of pending entries.

      • getPendingEntriesCountForPublisherInIntervals

        int[] getPendingEntriesCountForPublisherInIntervals​(int publisherId,
                                                    int[] lowerBounds,
                                                    int[] upperBounds)
        Gets an array with the number of new pending entries for a publisher in each intervals specified by lowerBounds and upperBounds. The interval is defined as from lowerBounds[i] to upperBounds[i] and the unit is seconds from now. A negative or 0 value results in no boundary.
        Parameters:
        publisherId - The publisher to count the number of pending entries for.
        lowerBounds - bound
        upperBounds - bound
        Returns:
        Array with the number of pending entries corresponding to each element in interval.

      • getPendingEntriesForPublisherWithLimit

        Collection<PublisherQueueData> getPendingEntriesForPublisherWithLimit​(int publisherId,
                                                                      int limit,
                                                                      int timeout,
                                                                      String orderBy)
        Finds all entries with status PublisherQueueData.STATUS_PENDING for a specific publisherId.
        Parameters:
        publisherId - ID
        limit - limit
        timeout - timeout
        orderBy - order by clause for the SQL to the database, for example "order by timeCreated desc".
        Returns:
        Collection of PublisherQueueData, never null

        Finds all entries for a specific fingerprint.
        Parameters:
        fingerprint - FP
        Returns:
        Collection of PublisherQueueData, never null

      • updateData

        void updateData​(String pk,
                int status,
                int tryCounter)
        Updates a record with new status
        Parameters:
        pk - primary key of data entry
        status - status from PublisherQueueData.STATUS_SUCCESS etc, or -1 to not update status
        tryCounter - an updated try counter, or -1 to not update counter

      • plainFifoTryAlwaysLimit100EntriesOrderByTimeCreated

        void plainFifoTryAlwaysLimit100EntriesOrderByTimeCreated​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                         int publisherId,
                                                         BasePublisher publisher)
        Intended for use from PublishQueueProcessWorker. Publishing algorithm that is a plain fifo queue, but limited to selecting entries to republish at 100 records at a time. It will select from the database for this particular publisher id, and process the record that is returned one by one. The records are ordered by date, descending so the oldest record is returned first. Publishing is tried every time for every record returned, with no limit. Repeat this process as long as we actually manage to publish something this is because when publishing starts to work we want to publish everything in one go, if possible. However we don't want to publish more than 20000 certificates each time, because we want to commit to the database some time as well. Now, the OCSP publisher uses a non-transactional data source so it commits every time so...
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        publisherId - ID
        publisher - pub

      • storeCertificateNonTransactional

        boolean storeCertificateNonTransactional​(BasePublisher publisher,
                                         AuthenticationToken admin,
                                         CertificateDataWrapper cert,
                                         String password,
                                         String userDN,
                                         ExtendedInformation extendedinformation)
                                  throws PublisherException
        Publishers do not run a part of regular transactions and expect to run in auto-commit mode.
        Parameters:
        publisher - Pub
        admin - admin
        cert - cert
        password - pwd
        userDN - DN
        extendedinformation - info
        Returns:
        bool
        Throws:
        PublisherException - fail

      • storeCRLNonTransactional

        boolean storeCRLNonTransactional​(BasePublisher publisher,
                                 AuthenticationToken admin,
                                 byte[] incrl,
                                 String cafp,
                                 int number,
                                 String userDN)
                          throws PublisherException
        Publishers do not run as part of regular transactions and expect to run in auto-commit mode.
        Parameters:
        publisher - pub
        admin - admin
        incrl - crl
        cafp - fp
        number - num
        userDN - dn
        Returns:
        crl
        Throws:
        PublisherException - fail

      • storeCertificateNonTransactionalInternal

        List<Object> storeCertificateNonTransactionalInternal​(List<BasePublisher> publishers,
                                                      AuthenticationToken admin,
                                                      CertificateDataWrapper certWrapper,
                                                      String password,
                                                      String userDN,
                                                      ExtendedInformation extendedinformation)
        Publishers do not run as part of regular transactions and expect to run in auto-commit mode. This method is invoked locally to publish to multiple publishers in parallel. The implementing method returns the result in the same order as the publishers are provided. Each result Object is either a PublisherException (if the publishing failed) or a Boolean.TRUE (if the publishing succeeded).
        Parameters:
        publishers - pub
        admin - admin
        certWrapper - cert
        password - pwd
        userDN - dn
        extendedinformation - info
        Returns:
        list
